title: Can I file for bankruptcy on my child support debt
question: I have child support debt.
question_tags: Child support,Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Debt,Debt discharge,Bankruptcy and debt,Fees
answers: Not in a Chapter 7, but in a Chapter 13.

First, you have the duty to list ALL debt including child support debt.

Second, whether a debt is discharged is a separate issue and child support per se is not a dischargeable type debt.

Third, when the Statute of Limitations (SOL) applies to each monthly installment and can be a defense depends on the state law governing and the facts and a Divorce attorney I advise to ask on that issue.

Fourth,many persons file ch 13 who owe child support. Many times in my District payments of partial amounts on arrears are continued outside the ch 13 plan and any remaining after the case is discharged remain non dischargeable at such time!

Finally, all of us will advise on one thing: always employ an experienced bankruptcy attorney near you! The exception: NEVER ANY EXCEPTION

As stated by other counsel, child support is not dischargeable, so a chapter 7 would not help you with a past due balance. A chapter 13 would allow you up to 5 years to bring child support currant. Please note, ongoing support must still be made. The chapter 13 only helps with past due support.
Consult and experienced bankruptcy attorney and have them review the order to verify that the order meets the criteria of support under the bankruptcy code. It is possible that other things were lumped into the support and you may be able to discharge some of what the state judgment calls support.
The bankruptcy laws will not forgive child support but may allow you to establish a payment plan based on your ability to pay.

The short answer is no. However, you can manage the support arrearages in a properly filed Chapter 13 case. That said, Chapter 13 cases rarely, if ever, are successfully completed without the assistance of a competent bankruptcy lawyer. In other words, this is not a DIY project. I recommend using the "Find a Lawyer" feature to find an Avvo bankruptcy lawyer having many 5 star reviews from actual satisfied clients. If you don't get a prompt call back from the lawyer, go on to the next one. Many times, some or most of the attorney fees can be included in your Plan of reorganization and paid out of your future earnings. There is no reason to say "I can't afford a lawyer". Many of us offer a free consultation by phone or in person. Take us up on it so you know as much about your options as possible. Good luck to you and God bless

A domestic support obligation is a non dischargeable debt. See 11 USC 523(a)(15). That being said, the actual order from the family law court has to be reviewed by a competent bankruptcy attorney to determine if the actual language of the order is a Domestic Support Obligation as defined in the bankruptcy code.
A chapter 7 bankruptcy will not wipe out your child support debt. A chapter 13 will allow you to pay it off over five years in an organized fashion.
